ngdocs for Encore-UI

Configs (encore.ui.configs)

Common configs used throughout Encore.

Unit tests for this only need to check for the existence of the config data, just to confirm that they're being loaded correctly. Anything more is just overkill.

Rx Active Url (encore.ui.rxActiveUrl)

    Servers Storage
      Volumes Snapshots

Adds a class name of 'selected' to an LI if the current url matches a pre-defined value

Markup

<ul>
    <rx-active-url url="/servers">
        <a href="/servers">Servers</a>
    </rx-active-url>
    <rx-active-url url="/cbs">
        <a href="/cbs">Storage</a>
        <ul>
            <rx-active-url url="/cbs/volumes">
                <a href="/cbs/volumes/">Volumes</a>
            </rx-active-url>
            <rx-active-url url="/cbs/snapshots">
                <a href="/cbs/snapshots/">Snapshots</a>
            </rx-active-url>
        </ul>
    </rx-active-url>
</ul>

Rx Age (encore.ui.rxAge)

  • {{ageHours}} → {{ageHours | rxAge}}
  • {{ageDays}} → {{ageDays | rxAge}}
  • {{ageMonths}} → {{ageMonths | rxAge}}
  • {{ageYears}} → {{ageYears | rxAge}}

Filter to parse an age based on a date in the past.

Note: This component requires moment.js be loaded.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxAgeCtrl">
    <ul>
        <li>{{ageHours}} &rarr; {{ageHours | rxAge}}</li>
        <li>{{ageDays}} &rarr; {{ageDays | rxAge}}</li>
        <li>{{ageMonths}} &rarr; {{ageMonths | rxAge}}</li>
        <li>{{ageYears}} &rarr; {{ageYears | rxAge}}</li>
    </ul>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

// This file is used to help build the 'demo' documentation page and should be updated with example code
function rxAgeCtrl ($scope) {
    var day = 86400000;
    $scope.ageHours = new Date((Date.now() - (day / 2.3)));
    $scope.ageDays = new Date((Date.now() - (day * 1.5)));
    $scope.ageMonths = new Date((Date.now() - (day * 40.2)));
    $scope.ageYears = new Date((Date.now() - (day * 380.1)));
}

Rx App (encore.ui.rxApp)

Standard rxApp

This is my page content

Customized rxApp

Click a link in the menu to see the active state change

Responsible for creating the HTML necessary for a common Encore layout.

Usage

For apps that want to use the default Encore navigation, usage is pretty simple. In your index.html file, add the rx-app directive inside your app:

<body ng-app="myApp">
    <rx-app>
        <ng-view></ng-view>
    </rx-app>
</body>

By including ng-view, your view content will be added inside the directive. This makes setting up views for each page much simpler, since you don't have to include rx-app in each view.

rx-page

You'll likely want to use rx-page inside your template view. For example, inside a 'myView.html' file:

<rx-page title="'Example Page'">
    Here is my content
</rx-page>

rx-page is used to create a common wrapper for specific page views. It automatically adds the breadcrumbs and page title/subtitle (if specified), along with the correct styling.

Both the title and subtitle attributes accept an Angular expression, which can be a string (shown in the previous example) or a scope property. This string/property can accept other expressions, enabling you to build custom titles. The demo has an example of this usage.

rx-app-nav and rx-app-nav-item

These two directives are responsible for creating the menu in the left sidebar. They're not intended for use outside of the rx-app template code.

Custom Menus

If you'd like to create an entirely custom menu, you can pass that data in to the rx-app directive via the 'menu' attribute. View the demo for an example of this.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxAppCtrl">
    <h3>Standard rxApp</h3>
    <rx-app>
        <rx-page title="'Standard Page Title'">
            This is my page content
        </rx-page>
    </rx-app>

    <h3>Customized rxApp</h3>
    <rx-app site-title="My App" menu="menuItems" id="custom-rxApp">
        <rx-page title="'Customized Page Title'" subtitle="subtitle">
            <p>Click a link in the menu to see the active state change</p>
            <button ng-click="changeSubtitle()" class="changeSubtitle">Change Subtitle</button>
        </rx-page>
    </rx-app>
</div>

<!--
You'll likely want to implement your HTML in your index.html file as:
<body ng-app="sampleApp">
    <rx-app ng-view></rx-app>
</body>

And the template for each view/page will be something like:
<rx-page title="'Example Page'">
    Example content
</rx-page>
-->

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
angular.module('demoApp')
.directive('sampleNavDirective', function () {
    return {
        restrict: 'E',
        template: '<input type="text" placeholder="Search">'
    };
});

function rxAppCtrl ($scope, $location, $rootScope) {
    $scope.subtitle = 'With a subtitle';

    $scope.changeSubtitle = function () {
        $scope.subtitle = 'With a new subtitle at ' + Date.now();
    };

    // Fake navigation
    var customApp = document.getElementById('custom-rxApp');
    customApp.addEventListener('click', function (ev) {
        var target = ev.target;

        if (target.className.indexOf('item-link') > -1) {
            // prevent the default jump to top
            ev.preventDefault();

            // update angular location
            $location.path(target.getAttribute('href'));
            $rootScope.$apply();
        }
    });

    $scope.menuItems = [{
        title: 'Example Menu',
        children: [
            {
                href: '#1',
                linkText: '1st Order Item'
            },
            {
                href: '#2',
                linkText: '1st Order Item w/ Children',
                // childHeader: 'Current Account {{ user }}',
                directive: 'sample-nav-directive',
                children: [
                    {
                        href: '#2-1',
                        linkText: '2nd Order Item',
                        children: [{
                            href: '#2-1-1',
                            linkText: '3rd Order Item'
                        }]
                    },
                    {
                        href: '#2-2',
                        linkText: '2nd Order Item w/ Children',
                        active: true,
                        children: [
                            {
                                href: '#2-2-1',
                                linkText: '3rd Order Item'
                            },
                            {
                                href: '#2-2-2',
                                linkText: '3rd Order Item w/ children',
                                active: true,
                                children: [
                                    {
                                        href: '#2-2-2-1',
                                        linkText: '4th Order Item',
                                        active: true
                                    },
                                    {
                                        href: '#2-2-2-2',
                                        linkText: '4th Order Item'
                                    }
                                ]
                            },
                            {
                                href: '#2-2-3',
                                linkText: '3rd Order Item'
                            }
                        ]
                    },
                    {
                        href: '#2-3',
                        linkText: '2nd Order Item'
                    }
                ]
            },
            {
                href: '#3',
                linkText: '1st Order Item'
            }
        ]
    }];
}

Rx Attributes (encore.ui.rxAttributes)

The following content gets replaced by the value of ng-bind. It also gets some styles applied to it:

Content that's replaced

The following content doesn't get replaced, since 'nothing' isn't a property on the scope:

Non-replaced content

The following content (you can't see it) does get replaced, but by nothing, since 'nothing' isn't a property on the scope. This is what rx-attributes avoids

Content that's unintentionally replaced

This component allows you to add attributes based on a value in scope being defined or not.

Example

<div rx-attributes="{'my-custom-attr': customAttrVal, 'ng-click': noFunc}" ng-controller="myCtrl"></div>

<script>
function myCtrl (scope) {
    scope.customAttrVal = 'some value';
}
</script>

Given this code, if the scope only had scope.customAttrVal set, only my-custom-attr would be added to the component. Since noFunc was never defined, ng-click isn't added.

The output of the above code is:

<div my-custom-attr="some value" ng-controller="myCtrl"></div>

Value Format

The value of rx-attributes follows the same object convention as ng-class, in that it takes in an object to parse through. The object follows this pattern:

{
    'attribute-name': scopeValue,
    'another-attribute-name': anotherScopeValue,
}

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxAttributesCtrl">
    <p><strong>The following content gets replaced by the value of ng-bind. It also gets some styles applied to it:</strong></p>
    <p rx-attributes="{'ng-bind': customContent, 'style': customStyles}">Content that's replaced</p>

    <p><strong>The following content doesn't get replaced, since 'nothing' isn't a property on the scope:</strong></p>
    <p rx-attributes="{'ng-bind': nothing}">Non-replaced content</p>

    <p><strong>The following content (you can't see it) does get replaced, but by nothing, since 'nothing' isn't a property on the scope. This is what rx-attributes avoids</strong></p>
    <p ng-bind="nothing">Content that's unintentionally replaced</p>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxAttributesCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.customStyles = 'color: red; font-weight: bold;';
    $scope.customContent = '"Custom Content"';
}

Rx Auth (encore.ui.rxAuth)

Auth service which provides a common mechanism authenticating, validating permissions and managing sessions.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxAuthCtrl">
    <button ng-click="hasRole()">Is a Superhero?</button>
    <button ng-click="isAuthenticated()">Is Authenticatd?</button>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxAuthCtrl ($scope, Auth) {
    $scope.hasRole = function () {
        alert('Has "superhero" Role? : ' + Auth.hasRole('superhero'));
    };

    $scope.isAuthenticated = function () {
        alert('Is Authenticated? : ' + Auth.isAuthenticated());
    };
}

Rx Breadcrumbs (encore.ui.rxBreadcrumbs)

Service/Directive to add/update breadcrumbs on a page

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxBreadcrumbsCtrl">
    <nav class="site-breadcrumbs">
        <rx-breadcrumbs></rx-breadcrumbs>
    </nav>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxBreadcrumbsCtrl ($scope, rxBreadcrumbsSvc) {
    rxBreadcrumbsSvc.set([{
        path: '/',
        name: 'Components'
    }, {
        name: 'All Components'
    }]);
}

Rx Button (encore.ui.rxButton)

Button for handling async operations.

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxButtonCtrl">
    <rx-button toggle-msg="Authenticating" default-msg="Login"
        toggle="status.loading" ng-click="login()">
    </rx-button>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxButtonCtrl ($scope, $timeout) {
    $scope.status = {
        loading: false
    };

    $scope.login = function () {
        $scope.status.loading = true;

        $timeout(function () {
            $scope.status.loading = false;
        }, 4000);
    };
}

Rx Capitalize (encore.ui.rxCapitalize)

{{hello | rxCapitalize}}

Capitalizes the first word in a string.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxCapitalizeCtrl">
    {{hello | rxCapitalize}}
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

function rxCapitalizeCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.hello = 'hello world. this is my text';
}

Rx Disk Size (encore.ui.rxDiskSize)

  • {{sizeGB}} → {{sizeGB | rxDiskSize}}
  • {{sizeTB}} → {{sizeTB | rxDiskSize}}
  • {{sizePB}} → {{sizePB | rxDiskSize}}

Converts GB disk size into a more readable format (e.g. GBs, TBs)

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxDiskSizeCtrl">
    <ul>
        <li>{{sizeGB}} &rarr; {{sizeGB | rxDiskSize}}</li>
        <li>{{sizeTB}} &rarr; {{sizeTB | rxDiskSize}}</li>
        <li>{{sizePB}} &rarr; {{sizePB | rxDiskSize}}</li>
    </ul>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

// This file is used to help build the 'demo' documentation page and should be updated with example code
function rxDiskSizeCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.sizeGB = 420;
    $scope.sizeTB = 125000;
    $scope.sizePB = 171337000;
}

Rx Dropdown (encore.ui.rxDropdown)

Rx Environment (encore.ui.rxEnvironment)

Current Environment: {{environment.name}}

Switch to:

Custom Environment Url: {{ { tld: 'cloudatlas', path: 'some/path' } | rxEnvironmentUrl }}

Content shows if staging: You're on a staging environment

Content shows if not production: You are not on a production environment

Component built to detect and provide the current environment (e.g. dev, staging, prod)

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxEnvironmentCtrl">
    <p>Current Environment: {{environment.name}}</p>

    <p>
        Switch to:
        <button ng-click="switchTo('local')">Local</button>
        <button ng-click="switchTo('staging')">Staging</button>
        <button ng-click="switchTo('production')">Production</button>
        <button ng-click="switchTo('ghPages')">GitHub Pages</button>
    </p>

    <p>Custom Environment Url: {{ { tld: 'cloudatlas', path: 'some/path' } | rxEnvironmentUrl }}</p>

    <p>Content shows if staging:
        <span rx-if-environment="staging">
            You're on a staging environment
        </span>
    </p>

    <p>Content shows if not production:
        <span rx-if-environment="!production">
            You are not on a production environment
        </span>
    </p>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxEnvironmentCtrl ($scope, Environment) {
    Environment.add({
        name: 'ghPages',
        pattern: '//rackerlabs.github.io/encore-ui/',
        url: '//rackerlabs.github.io/encore-ui/{{path}}'
    });

    $scope.switchTo = function (envName) {
        Environment.set(envName);
    };
}

Rx Form (encore.ui.rxForm)

Example of simple text input

Bound Value: {{volume.name}}

Radio Buttons

Restart?

Bound Value: {{volume.option}}

Select Box

Bound Value: {{volume.type}}

Option Table

Bound Value: {{volume.data}}

Item 1 Value: {{volume.checked[0]}}

Item 2 Value: {{volume.checked[1]}}

RxForm is a set of directives used to create forms throughout Encore. These directives provide a common HTML layout and style for all form elements, which helps ensure form accessibility and makes creating new forms easier.

NOTE: rxFormInput, rxFormRadio and rxFormSelect are deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Please use rxFormItem for all your form input needs!

Markup

<div class="forms" ng-controller="rxFormDemoCtrl">
    <h3>Example of simple text input</h3>
    <rx-form-item label="Display Name" description="<a href='#'>Here</a> is my <b>HTML</b>" prefix="$" suffix="GB">
        <input type="text" ng-model="volume.name" ng-required="true" />
    </rx-form-item>
    <p>Bound Value: {{volume.name}}</p>

    <h3>Radio Buttons</h3>
    <fieldset>
        <legend>Restart?</legend>
        <rx-form-item label="Yes" description="{{yesOptionDescription}}">
            <input type="radio" name="volume-option" ng-model="volume.option" value="yes" />
        </rx-form-item>
        <rx-form-item label="Apartment" suffix="Sq. Ft.">
            <input type="radio" name="volume-option" ng-model="volume.option" value="upstairs" />
        </rx-form-item>
        <rx-form-item label="Green">
            <input type="radio" name="volume-option" ng-model="volume.option" value="purple" />
        </rx-form-item>
    </fieldset>
    <p>Bound Value: {{volume.option}}</p>

    <h3>Select Box</h3>
    <rx-form-item label="Type" prefix="$">
        <span class="field-select">
            <select ng-model="volume.type" ng-required="true">
                <option
                    ng-repeat="type in types"
                    value="{{type.value}}"
                    ng-selected="{{type.value == model}}"
                    >{{type.label}}</option>
            </select>
        </span>
    </rx-form-item>
    <p>Bound Value: {{volume.type}}</p>

    <h3>Option Table</h3>
    <rx-form-option-table
        data="optionTableData"
        columns="optionTableColumns"
        type="radio"
        model="volume.data"
        field-id="optionTable"
        selected="0"
        ></rx-form-option-table>
    <p>Bound Value: {{volume.data}}</p>

    <rx-form-option-table
        columns="optionTableColumns"
        type="checkbox"
        model="volume.checked"
        field-id="optionCheckboxTable"
        data="optionTableCheckboxData"
        ></rx-form-option-table>
    <p>Item 1 Value: {{volume.checked[0]}}</p>
    <p>Item 2 Value: {{volume.checked[1]}}</p>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxFormDemoCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.types = [
        {
            'value': 'SATA',
            'label': 'SATA'
        },
        {
            'value': 'SSD',
            'label': 'SSD'
        }
    ];

    $scope.volume = {
        name: 'Volume-1',
        type: _.first($scope.types).value, // select the first type by default
        checked: [true, 'unchecked'] //example with first checkbox automatically checked
    };

    $scope.yesOptionDescription = '<b>This</b> is HTML that included in the JS';

    $scope.optionTableData = [
        {
            'name': 'Option #1',
            'value': 0,
            'obj': {
                'name': 'Nested Name 1'
            }
        }, {
            'name': 'Option #2',
            'value': 1,
            'obj': {
                'name': 'Nested Name 2'
            }
        }, {
            'name': 'Option #3',
            'value': 2,
            'obj': {
                'name': 'Nested Name 3'
            }
        }
    ];

    $scope.optionTableColumns = [{
        'label': 'Name',
        'key': 'name',
        'selectedLabel': '(Already saved data)'
    }, {
        'label': 'Static Content',
        'key': 'Some <strong>Text &</strong> HTML'
    }, {
        'label': 'Expression 2',
        'key': '{{ value * 100 | number:2 }}'
    }, {
        'label': 'Expression 3',
        'key': '{{ obj.name | uppercase }}'
    }, {
        'label': 'Expression 4',
        'key': '{{ value | currency }}'
    }];

    $scope.optionTableCheckboxData = [{
        'name': 'Item 1'
    }, {
        'name': 'Item 2',
        'value': 'checked',
        'falseValue': 'unchecked'
    }];
}

Rx Identity (encore.ui.rxIdentity)

Service for authenticating with Rackspaces' Identity service

Markup

<!-- Example only works when running locally since rxIdentity requires a proxy -->
<div ng-controller="rxIdentityCtrl">
    <form>
        <label>Username:</label>
        <input type="text" name="username" ng-model="user.username" />
        <label>Password:</label>
        <input type="password" name="password" ng-model="user.password" />
        <rx-button toggle-msg="Authenticating" default-msg="Login"
            toggle="toggle" ng-click="login()"></rx-button>
    </form>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxIdentityCtrl ($scope, Identity) {
    $scope.user = {};
    $scope.login = function () {
        $scope.toggle = true;
        Identity.login($scope.user,
            function (authToken) {
                $scope.toggle = false;
                alert('Congrats! Logged In');
            },
            function (error) {
                $scope.toggle = false;
                alert('Login attempt failed.');
            });
    };
}

Rx Local Storage (encore.ui.rxLocalStorage)

Simple wrapper of the global session localStorage object for interacting with local storage.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxLocalStorageCtrl">
    <label>Who is the Joker's side kick?</label>
    <button ng-click="setSideKick()">Store Answer</button>
    <button ng-click="getSideKick()">Answer?</button>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxLocalStorageCtrl ($scope, LocalStorage) {
    $scope.setSideKick = function () {
        LocalStorage.setObject('joker', { name: 'Harley Quinn' });
    };

    $scope.getSideKick = function () {
        var sidekick = LocalStorage.getObject('joker');
        alert(sidekick.name);
    };
}

Rx Logout (encore.ui.rxLogout)

Logout

Attribute directive to add logout functionality to a link.

Markup

<div>
    <a href="#" rx-logout>Logout</a>
</div>

Rx Modal Action (encore.ui.rxModalAction)

Password: {{password}}

Change Password

Hook into Angular-UI Bootstrap's modal directive. Used as a link to open a modal window.

This module has a dependency on Angular-UI Bootstrap, so if it's going to be used, bootstrap needs to be included in your webpage.

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxModalActionCtrl">
    <p>Password: {{password}}</p>
    <rx-modal-action
        pre-hook="populate(this)"
        post-hook="changePass(fields)"
        template-url="changePassword.html">
        Change Password
    </rx-modal-action>
    <script type="text/ng-template" id="changePassword.html">
        <rx-modal-form title="Change Admin Password">
            <p>Change {{user}} password?</p>
            <rx-form-input
                type="text"
                required="true"
                label="New Password"
                field-id="server_password"
                model="fields.password"></rx-form-input>
        </rx-modal-form>
    </script>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxModalActionCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.password = 'guest';

    $scope.populate = function (modalScope) {
        modalScope.user = 'hey_dude';
    };

    $scope.changePass = function (fields) {
        $scope.password = fields.password;
    };
}

Rx Notify (encore.ui.rxNotify)

Type:
Show:

rxPromiseNotifications

Page Stack

Custom Stack

Using rx-notification

Hello, world! Hello, world! Hello, world!

Service (rxNotify) and Directives (rxNotification and rxNotifications) for displaying status messages on a page.

Using rxNotification as a State Message

There may be situations where you will need to use the styling/markup of rxNotify's messaging queue in status messages of your own - for example, a modal window which asks if you want to delete an object, with the appropriate warning or error flags. If this is the case, we recommend using the rx-notification directive in your views (note difference of rx-notifications.

<rx-notification type="warn">This is warning message!</rx-notification>

For all values of warn, please look below under Message options, under type.

Adding a New Message Queue via rxNotify

To add a new message to a stack, inject 'rxNotify' into your function and run:

rxNotify.add('My Message Text');

This will add a new message to the default stack ('page') with all default options set. To customize options, pass in an object as the second argument with you specific options set:

rxNotify.add('My Message Text', {

stack: 'custom',

type: 'warning'

});

Message options

  • type: Message type.

    Default: 'info'

    Other values: 'warn', 'error', 'success'

  • timeout: Time (in seconds) for message to appear.

    Default: -1 (Message displays indefinitely)

    Other values: Any positive integer

  • dismissable: Whether a user can dismiss the message via an 'x' icon.

    Default: true

    Other values: false

  • loading Replaces type icon with spinner. Removes option for use to dismiss message.

    Default: false

    Other values: true

    You usually want to associate this with a 'dismiss' property.

    Example:

    rxNotify.add('Loading', {

    loading: true,

    dismiss: [$scope, 'loaded']

    });

    var apiCallback = function (data) {

    $scope.loaded = true;

    // do something with the data

    }

    myApiCall(apiCallback);

  • show: When to have the message appear.

    Default: 'immediately'

    Other values:

    'next': Show message after the next route change

    [scope, 'property']:

    Pass in a property on a scope to watch for a change. When the property value equals true, the message is shown.

    Example:

    $scope.loaded = false;

    rxNotify.add('Content loaded!', {

    show: [$scope, 'loaded']

    });

    $timeout(function () {

    $scope.loaded = true;

    }, 1500);

  • dismiss: When to have the message disappear.

    Default: 'next' (Dismiss message after the next route change)

    Other values:

    [scope, 'property']:

    Pass in a property on a scope to watch for a change. When the property value equals true, the message is dismissed.

    Example:

    $scope.loaded = false;

    rxNotify.add('Loading Content', {

    dismiss: [$scope, 'loaded']

    });

    $timeout(function () {

    $scope.loaded = true;

    }, 1500);

  • stack: Which message stack the message gets added to.

    Default: 'page'

    Other values: Any string

    Example:

    rxNotify.add('Username required', {

    type: 'error',

    stack: 'loginForm'

    });

    <rx-notifications stack="loginForm"></rx-notifications>

Dismissing a message programatically

Most messages are dismissed either by the user, a route change or using the custom 'dismiss' property.

If you need to dismiss a message programmaticaly, you can run rxNotify.dismiss(message), where message is the message object to dismiss.

If you don't have the full message object, passing in the Message ID (which is returned from rxNotify.add) and the stack the message is in: rxNotify.dismiss('42', 'page').

Stacks

Stacks are just separate notification areas. Normally, all messages created will go to the 'page' stack, which should be displayed at the top of the page. It's used for page-level messages.

You can also create custom stacks for speficic notification areas. Say you have a form on your page that you want to add error messages to. You can create a custom stack for this form and send form-specific messages to it.

Using the Page Stack

The default notification stack is added by default to the page template, so it should be ready to use without any work (unless the app uses a custom template). The HTML to add the default stack to the page is:

<rx-notifications></rx-notifications>

Note that a 'stack' attribute does not need to be defined.

Creating a Custom Stack

See 'stack' under 'Message options'

Clearing all messages in a stack

You can clear all messages in a specific stack programmatically via the rxNotify.clear function. Simply pass in the name of the stack to clear: rxNotify.clear('page').

rxPromiseNotifications

It's a common pattern with API requests that you'll show a loading message, followed by either a success or failure message depending on the result of the call. rxPromiseNotifications is the service created for this pattern. See the API docs for more information on how to call/use rxPromiseNotifications.

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxNotifyCtrl">
    <div class="form-item">
        <label>Message text: <input type="text" ng-model="message" /></label>
    </div>

    <div class="form-item">
        <label>Timeout (in seconds): <input type="text" ng-model="options.timeout" /></label>
    </div>

    <div class="form-item">
        <fieldset>
            <legend>Type:</legend>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-type" ng-model="options.type" value="info" /> Info</label>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-type" ng-model="options.type" value="success" /> Success</label>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-type" ng-model="options.type" value="warning" /> Warning</label>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-type" ng-model="options.type" value="error" /> Error</label>
        </fieldset>
    </div>

    <div class="form-item">
        <fieldset>
            <legend>Show:</legend>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-show" ng-model="options.show" value="immediate" /> Immediately</label>
            <label><input type="radio" name="notify-show" ng-model="options.show" value="next" /> Next</label>
        </fieldset>
    </div>

    <div class="form-item">
        <label>Dismissable (by user): <input type="checkbox" ng-model="options.dismissable" /></label>
    </div>

    <div class="form-item">
        <label>Loading? (shows spinner): <input type="checkbox" ng-model="options.loading" /></label>
    </div>

    <div>
        <button ng-click="add('page')">Add to Page Stack</button>
        <button ng-click="add('custom')">Add to Custom Stack</button>
    </div>

    <div>
        <h3>rxPromiseNotifications</h3>
        <button ng-click="addPromise()">Create messages</button>
        <button ng-click="deferred.resolve();">Resolve Promise</button>
        <button ng-click="deferred.reject();">Reject Promise</button>
    </div>

    <div>
        <button ng-click="routeChange()">Simulate Route Change</button>
    </div>

    <div class="pure-g">
        <div class="pure-u-1-2">
            <h2>Page Stack</h2>
            <rx-notifications></rx-notifications>
        </div>

        <div class="pure-u-1-2">
            <h2>Custom Stack</h2>
            <rx-notifications stack="custom"></rx-notifications>
        </div>
    </div>

    <p>Using rx-notification</p>

    <rx-notification type="error">Hello, world!</rx-notification>
    <rx-notification type="warning">Hello, world!</rx-notification>    
    <rx-notification type="info">Hello, world!</rx-notification>    
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

function rxNotifyCtrl ($rootScope, $scope, rxNotify, rxPromiseNotifications, $q) {
    $scope.message = 'My message';

    $scope.options = {
        type: 'info',
        timeout: -1,
        dismissable: true,
        show: 'immediate'
    };

    $scope.routeChange = function (stack) {
        $rootScope.$broadcast('$routeChangeStart', {});
        $rootScope.$broadcast('$routeChangeSuccess', {});
    };

    $scope.add = function (stack) {
        var messageOptions = _.clone($scope.options);
        messageOptions.stack = stack;

        rxNotify.add($scope.message, messageOptions);
    };

    // add a default messages
    rxNotify.add('Helpful Information');
    rxNotify.add('Loading', {
        loading: true
    });
    rxNotify.add('You did it!', {
        type: 'success'
    });
    rxNotify.add('Careful now...', {
        type: 'warning'
    });
    rxNotify.add('Under Attack by Aliens', {
        type: 'error',
        stack: 'custom'
    });

    // stuff for rxPromiseNotifications
    $scope.addPromise = function () {
        $scope.deferred = $q.defer();

        var promiseScope = rxPromiseNotifications.add($scope.deferred.promise, {
            loading: 'Loading Message',
            success: 'Success Message',
            error: 'Error Message'
        });
    };
}

Rx Page Title (encore.ui.rxPageTitle)

Current Title: {{pageTitle}}

Service for managing the page titles.

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxPageTitleCtrl">
    Current Title: {{pageTitle}} <button ng-click="refreshTitle()">Get Updated Title</button><br />

    <input type="text" ng-change="changeTitle()" ng-model="newTitle" placeholder="New Title" />
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

// This file is used to help build the 'demo' documentation page and should be updated with example code
function rxPageTitleCtrl ($scope, rxPageTitle) {
    $scope.changeTitle = function () {
        rxPageTitle.setTitle($scope.newTitle);
    };

    $scope.refreshTitle = function () {
        $scope.pageTitle = rxPageTitle.getTitle();
    };

    $scope.refreshTitle();
}

Rx Paginate (encore.ui.rxPaginate)

Name OS
{{server.name}} {{server.os}}

Used for adding pagination around a data object

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxPaginateCtrl">
    <table class="table-striped">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th class="column-title" style="width:10em;">Name</th>
                <th class="column-title">OS</a>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            <tr ng-repeat="server in servers | orderBy: sorter.predicate:sorter.reverse | Paginate:pager ">
                <td>
                    {{server.name}}
                </td>
                <td>{{server.os}}</td>
            </tr>
        </tbody>
        <tfoot>
            <tr class="paginate-area">
                <td colspan="12">
                    <rx-paginate page-tracking="pager"></rx-paginate>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </tfoot>
    </table>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

// This file is used to help build the 'demo' documentation page and should be updated with example code
function rxPaginateCtrl ($scope, PageTracking) {
    $scope.sorter = {
        predicate: 'id',
        reverse: false
    };
    $scope.pager = PageTracking.createInstance();
    $scope.pager.itemsPerPage = 3;

    var makeServers = function (serverCount) {
        var servers = [];
        var os = ['Ubuntu 12.04', 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.4', 'CentOS 6.4', 'Ubuntu 13.04'];
        for (var i = 1; i < serverCount + 1; i++) {
            var server = {
                id: i,
                name: 'Server ' + i,
                os: os[i % os.length]
            };
            servers.push(server);
        }
        return servers;
    };
    $scope.servers = makeServers(21);
}

Rx Permission (encore.ui.rxPermission)

Service and directive for mananging permissions in EncoreUI

Markup

<!-- Sample HTML goes here as a live example of how to the component can be used -->
<div ng-controller="rxPermissionCtrl">
    <button class="storeToken" name="button" ng-click="storeToken()">Store Token</button>
    <button class="clearToken" name="button" ng-click="clearToken()">Clear Token</button>

    <rx-permission role="test">
        <rx-notifications stack="permission"></rx-notifications>
    </rx-permission>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxPermissionCtrl ($scope, Session, rxNotify) {
    rxNotify.add('Respect My Authority!!', {
        stack: 'permission',
        type: 'warning'
    });

    $scope.storeToken = function () {
        Session.storeToken({ access: { user: { roles: [{ name: 'test' } ] }}});
    }

    $scope.clearToken = function () {
        Session.logoff();
    };
}

Rx Product Resources (encore.ui.rxProductResources)

Rx Related Menu (encore.ui.rxRelatedMenu)

Rx Session (encore.ui.rxSession)

Service for managing user session in encore-ui.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxSessionCtrl">
    <button ng-click="isAuthenticated()">Is Authenticated</button>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxSessionCtrl ($scope, Session) {

    $scope.isAuthenticated = function () {
        alert(Session.isAuthenticated());
    };
}

Rx Session Storage (encore.ui.rxSessionStorage)

A simple wrapper of the global sessionStorage object for interacting with session storage. This service is similar to angular's $window and $document services. The API is exactly the same as the W3C's specification provided at: http://dev.w3.org/html5/webstorage/#storage-0

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxSessionStorageCtrl">
    <label>Who is Batman's side kick?</label>
    <button ng-click="setSideKick()">Store Answer</button>
    <button ng-click="getSideKick()">Answer?</button>
</div>

JavaScript

function rxSessionStorageCtrl ($scope, SessionStorage) {
    $scope.setSideKick = function () {
        SessionStorage.setItem('Batman', 'Robin');
    };

    $scope.getSideKick = function () {
        alert(SessionStorage.getItem('Batman'));
    };
}

Rx Sortable Column (encore.ui.rxSortableColumn)

Name Occupation
{{resource.name}} {{resource.jobTitle}}

A clickable link in a table heading which will sort the table by the referenced property in ascending or descending order.

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxSortableColumnCtrl">
    <table>
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th scope="col">
                    <rx-sortable-column
                        sort-method="sortCol"
                        sort-property="name"
                        predicate="sort.predicate"
                        reverse="sort.reverse">
                        Name
                    </rx-sortable-column>
                </th>
                <th scope="col">
                    <rx-sortable-column
                        sort-method="sortCol"
                        sort-property="jobTitle"
                        predicate="sort.predicate"
                        reverse="sort.reverse">
                        Occupation
                    </rx-sortable-column>
                </th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody id="talentPoolData">
            <tr ng-repeat="resource in talentPool | orderBy:sort.predicate:sort.reverse">
                <th scope="row" class="talent-name">
                    {{resource.name}}
                </th>
                <td class="talent-job">
                    {{resource.jobTitle}}
                </td>
            </tr>
        </tbody>
    </table>
</div>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/

// This file is used to help build the 'demo' documentation page and should be updated with example code
function rxSortableColumnCtrl ($scope, PageTracking, rxSortUtil) {
    $scope.sort = rxSortUtil.getDefault();
    $scope.pager = PageTracking.createInstance();

    $scope.sortCol = function (predicate) {
        return rxSortUtil.sortCol($scope, predicate);
    };

    $scope.talentPool = [
        {
            name: 'Andrew Yurisich',
            jobTitle: 'Mailroom Associate IV'
        },
        {
            name: 'Patrick Deuley',
            jobTitle: 'Design Chaplain'
        },
        {
            name: 'Hussam Dawood',
            jobTitle: 'Evangelist of Roger Enriquez'
        },
        {
            name: 'Kerry Bowley',
            jobTitle: 'Dev Mom'
        },
    ];
}

Rx Spinner (encore.ui.rxSpinner)

Spinning = {{loading}}

Add a spinner icon to any element

Markup

<div ng-controller="rxSpinnerCtrl">
    <div rx-spinner toggle="loading" class="rxSpinnerExample">Spinning = {{loading}}</div>
    <button ng-click="toggleLoading()">Toggle Loading</button>
</div>
<style type="text/css">
.rxSpinnerExample {
    background: #00ac31;
    padding: 20px;
    color: white;
    line-height: 20px;
}
</style>

JavaScript

/*jshint unused:false*/
function rxSpinnerCtrl ($scope) {
    $scope.loading = false;

    $scope.toggleLoading = function () {
        $scope.loading = !$scope.loading;
    };
}
